title: IBM Cloud Shell docs
introduction: IBM Cloud Shell is a workspace that you can access through your browser. Cloud Shell is preconfigured with the full IBM Cloud CLI, plug-ins, and tools that you can use to manage apps, resources, and infrastructure.

section_recommended.title: Getting started with IBM Cloud Shell
section_recommended.description: IBM Cloud Shell is a cloud-based shell workspace that's preconfigured with the full IBM Cloud CLI and several plug-ins and tools.

section_recommended.title: Troubleshooting for IBM Cloud Shell
section_recommended.description: Use the tips in this section to help troubleshoot problems that you might run into when you use IBM Cloud Shell.

section_recommended.title: Working in Cloud Shell
section_recommended.description: IBM Cloud Shell contains a personal workspace and sessions where you can run commands.

tiles.title: Tokyo region is deprecated for IBM Cloud Shell
tiles.description: The Tokyo region for Cloud Shell is deprecated and will no longer be supported by Cloud Shell as of 2 July 2024.

tiles.title: Simple Python Version Management (`pyenv`) is now available on IBM Cloud Shell
tiles.description: A preinstalled Python 3.11.2 is available by using `pyenv`.

tiles.title: The ibmcloud dev app commands are no longer available
tiles.description: When you deploy or run your application on Docker, the `ibmcloud dev` app commands are no longer available, including `ibmcloud dev build` and `ibmcloud dev run`. However, you can still use Docker commands in IBM Cloud Shell.
